title: Strengthening E-Learning Practical Skills: Design Thinking-Based Mathematics Instruction for Creative Risk Facilitation

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can propose at least three creative math lesson models using idea-generation techniques from each stage of design thinking.

Learners apply a dynamic decision-making framework (e.g., OODA loop) to select optimal instructional strategies (blended, flipped, project-based, etc.) from five options under three resource constraints (time, budget, personnel) based on evaluation criteria (effectiveness, efficiency, feasibility) and achieve a suitability score of over 80% in a simulation environment.
Learners can derive at least two improvement strategies through failure case analysis and apply them to the redesign process.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
